# Read in data

```{r}

rna_tcr <- read.csv("../saved_data/rna_tcr_no_na_good_cell_typing.csv")

rna_tcr <- rna_tcr %>%
  bind_rows(mutate(rna_tcr, predicted.celltype.l1 = "All T cells"))

```

# Analyze diversity

```{r}

cdr3_amino_acid_diversity_df <- rna_tcr %>%
  filter(!(is.na(cdr3)),
         Chain != "Multi",
         group != "no ICI") %>%
  group_by(cdr3, Chain, orig.ident, group, predicted.celltype.l1) %>%
  mutate(cdr3_amino_acid_count = n()) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  group_by(orig.ident, Chain, predicted.celltype.l1) %>%
  # Calculate Shannon diversity index (H)
  mutate(shannon = diversity(cdr3_amino_acid_count),
         inv_shannon = 1/diversity(cdr3_amino_acid_count)) %>%
  slice(1) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  select(Chain, group, orig.ident, shannon, inv_shannon, predicted.celltype.l1)

cdr3_amino_acid_diversity_df

cdr3_amino_acid_diversity_df$group <- factor(cdr3_amino_acid_diversity_df$group, levels = c("no ICI", "ICI no colitis", "ICI colitis"))

p <- ggplot(cdr3_amino_acid_diversity_df, aes(x = Chain, y = shannon, fill = group)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_wrap(~ predicted.celltype.l1, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(x = "Chain",
       y = "Shannon entropy",
       fill = "Group")

# Adjust y-axis scales with a specified number of ticks
p + scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5)), breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 3))

# Shannon entropy: 0 means monoclonal, higher means polyclonal, weights richness (total # of unique clones) over evenness

p <- ggplot(cdr3_amino_acid_diversity_df, aes(x = Chain, y = inv_shannon, fill = group)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_wrap(~ predicted.celltype.l1, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(x = "Chain",
       y = "Inverse Shannon entropy",
       fill = "Group")

# Adjust y-axis scales with a specified number of ticks
p + scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5)), breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 3))

# assuming higher inverse means monoclonal, lower inverse means polyclonal

# Filter the data for statistical test
test_data <- cdr3_amino_acid_diversity_df %>%
  filter(Chain == "TRB",
         predicted.celltype.l1 == "All T cells",
         group != "no ICI")

# Calculate the Wilcoxon rank-sum test statistic and p-value
wilcox_result <- wilcox.test(test_data$inv_shannon ~ test_data$group)

# Print the results
print(wilcox_result)

# TRA != no ICI other T: 0.0293
# TRB != no ICI other T: 0.1079

# TRA != no ICI CD8 T: 0.1079
# TRB != no ICI CD8 T: 0.1419

p_values <- c(0.0293, 0.1079, 0.1079, 0.1419)

# Adjust p-values using the Benjamini-Hochberg method (default method)
adjusted_p_values <- p.adjust(p_values, method = "BH")

# Print the adjusted p-values
print(adjusted_p_values)

```
